Title: Middleware doesn't belong in the router
Description: In most server-side web apps/APIs we’ll often use some form of middleware to enhance how our apps work. Typically, this is achieved by registering a special form of request handler upstream of our endpoints. This middleware is assigned to a specific route pattern. Hence, middleware are decoupled at the framework- or router-level from our endpoints.
